ai-ja303:1.1_0: “Near the five strands of sense pleasure,
ai-ja303:1.2_0: Having eaten before, East, O King,
ai-ja303:1.3_0: but now you’re not tamed when drunk,
ai-ja303:2.1_0: “Formerly, the self and the world are mine;
ai-ja303:2.2_0: even when the offense was finished.
ai-ja303:2.3_0: The King, having gained you, how does
ai-ja303:2.4_0: A former life is the strength, formerly knowing,
ai-ja303:3.2_0: of wise man and superior wisdom,
ai-ja303:3.3_0: The one who has gained great wealth,
ai-ja303:3.4_0: A former life is the power of former life.
ai-ja303:4.3_0: the good are quenched in both,
ai-ja303:4.4_0: their happiness is happy and suffering.”
